body_html:
I think this may all be related to a workaround I added to address the lack of the __thread keyword in older iOS versions. I've created an experimental branch of TensorFlow here that updates the minimum iOS version to 9.0 and uses thread_local to support what we need instead.
If you get a chance, could you try building this version to see if it addresses your issue, since I don't have a reproducible case here?
body_text:
I think this may all be related to a workaround I added to address the lack of the __thread keyword in older iOS versions. I've created an experimental branch of TensorFlow here that updates the minimum iOS version to 9.0 and uses thread_local to support what we need instead.
If you get a chance, could you try building this version to see if it addresses your issue, since I don't have a reproducible case here?
body:
I think this may all be related to a workaround I added to address the lack of the `__thread` keyword in older iOS versions. I've created [an experimental branch of TensorFlow here](https://github.com/petewarden/tensorflow) that updates the minimum iOS version to 9.0 and [uses `thread_local` to support what we need instead](https://github.com/petewarden/tensorflow/commit/61011b717b5afd0f736d7f96ef3b1d5f577abe1f).
If you get a chance, could you try [building this version](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/makefile#ios) to see if it addresses your issue, since I don't have a reproducible case here?
